explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups present in the molecule associated with explosive or self-reactive properties.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid (melting point <= 140degC) substances are not available. ((97.2-101.7degC (HSDB (2002)))

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

organic_peroxides.rationale: Organic compounds containing no bivalent -O-O- structure in the molecule

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on its rat LD50 of > 5000 mg/kg bw (JMPR (1998), HSDB (2002)), the substance was classified into the "Not classified" category using the JIS classification criteria (Not classified in the United States classification as well).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on its rat LD50 of > 2000 mg/kg bw (JMPR (1998)), the substance was classified into the "Not classified" category using the JIS classification criteria (Category 5 or "Not classified" in the United Nations classification).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on its rat LC50 values of > 5.6 mg/L (JMPR (1998)) and 5.6 mg/L/4h (HSDB (2002)), the substance was classified into the "Not classified" category.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: In skin irritation tests using rabbits that underwent 4-hour application, almost no erythema was detected (JMPR (1998)). Similarly, in skin irritation tests using rats, merely mild erythema was observed (JMPR (1998)). Based on these results, the substance was classified into the "Not classified" category.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: In eye irritation tests using rabbits, conjunctival redness (score: 0.1-4) was noted and it healed after 72 hours (JMPR (1998)). Based on this information, the substance was classified into Category 2B.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: In maximization tests using guinea pigs (JMPR (1998)), no reaction to the application was noted (JMPR (1998)). Despite this information, classification is not possible due to insufficient data available.

carcinogenicity.rationale: Based on negative results acquired in micronucleus tests using bone marrow of rats or mice that underwent intraperitoneal administration (in vivo mutagenicity tests using somatic cells) (JMPR (1998)), the substance was classified into the "Not classified" category. Also, the following tests gave negative results: DNA damage tests using rat hepatocytes (in vivo genotoxicity tests using somatic cells), Ames tests, gene mutation tests using ovarian cells of Chinese hamsters, and chromosomal aberration tests using human lymphocytes (JMPR (1998)). In chromosomal aberration tests using pneumocytes of Chinese Hamsters, negative results were obtained with metabolic activation system being excluded (-S9) while positive results were obtained with metabolic activation system being included (+S9) (JMPR (1998)).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: In 24-month oral administration tests using rats, incidences of cancer or adenoma in the liver significantly increased (JMPR (1998)). Due to this information, and because the substance is rated as Category 3 in terms of carcinogenicity in the EU classification, the substance was classified into Category 2.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: In two-generation reproduction studies using rats, no effects of the substance were detected in terms of mating in parental animals, fertility, pregnancy, and live birth index (JMPR (1998)). In addition, in oral route exposure tests conducted during the organogenetic period using rats or rabbits, no effects on the development of offspring were detected (JMPR (1998)). Based on these results, the substance was classified into the "Not classified" category.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause respiratory irritation (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: In oral administration tests using mice or rats, no abnormalities of the organs were found even at a dose (5000 mg/kg bw) above the upper limit of Category 2 guidance values (JMPR (1998)). However, in inhalation tests using rats, non-specific clinical symptoms (accelerated and intermittent respiration, urine-smeared fur, reddish nose, eye discharge, and reddish eyelid crust, etc.) were seen at 2 and 5.6 mg/L concentrations, and these symptoms healed the following day (JMPR (1998)). Based on this information, the substance was classified into Category3 (respiratory tract irritation).

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
aspiration_hazard.rationale: In several oral administration tests using rats (test duration: 28 and 90 days), mice (28 days and 3 months), or dogs (3 and 12 months) (JMPR (1998)), and in dermal administration tests using rats (JMPR (1998)), a decreased body weight, increased liver weight, or other effects on the liver were noted at doses above Category 2 guidance values. However, NOAEL (90-day conversion: 1152 mg/kg/day and 150 mg/kg/day) are higher than Category 2 guidance doses, and no toxicity related to specific target organ toxicity at Category 2 guidance doses was recognized. Though this information leads to classification of the substance into the "Not classified" category (oral and dermal), it was classified into "Classification not possible" because its toxic effects through inhalation route are unknown.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since its 96-hour EC50 = 0.0551 mg/L for algae (Pseudokirchneriella subcapitata) (AQUIRE, 2008), the substance was classified into Category 1.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since its classification for acute toxicity is Category 1, and it is not rapidly degradable (BIOWIN), the substance was classified into Category 1.
